The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Diplazoptilon is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Americas, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
